headline: GOP Sen Candidate Shoots At Biden, Pelosi Lookalikes In 'Disgusting' Ad
author: Lee Moran
sentences:
https://t.co/wbFO0wU76O
— Fred Guttenberg (@fred_guttenberg) February 10, 2022
In which a Republican candidate for Senate play acts shooting a gun at, among others, Senator Mark Kelly, whose wife, former Congresswoman Gabby Giffords, was gravely injured by gunfire in real life.

This ad will do more to boost Mark Kelly’s fundraising than help Republicans.”
Advertisement
Others agreed, saying it was particularly egregious because Kelly’s wife, former Rep. Gabrielle Giffords (D-Ariz.), was seriously wounded in 2011 during a mass shooting.

Jim Lamon, a Republican candidate for senator in Arizona, drew widespread condemnation on Thursday for a campaign ad in which he shoots at actors portraying President Joe Biden, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-Calif.) and incumbent Sen. Mark Kelly (D-Ariz.).

https://t.co/MJ4mac4LMj via @YouTube
— Brian Murray (@BrianMurrayAZ) February 10, 2022
Report this shitty Jim Lamon tweet for threats of violence against Sen. Mark Kelly, Nancy Pelosi, and Joe Biden.

pic.twitter.com/mJTbFuS0du
— Jim Lamon (@jim_lamon) February 10, 2022
Blake Masters and Michael McGuire, two of Lamon’s GOP rivals in the race, led the chorus of criticism.

https://t.co/MqAxXMP4Ga
— Jax Persists (@LadyJayPersists) February 10, 2022
GOP candidate runs ad about shooting his gun at Mark Kelly, Joe Biden and Nancy Pelosi.

The 70-second commercial dubs Biden “Old Joe,” Pelosi “Crazyface,” and Kelly “Shifty.”
Advertisement
“The good people of Arizona have had enough of you.

It’s time for a showdown,” Lamon says in the video that will reportedly air on television statewide on Sunday, including during the Super Bowl.
